name: Focus particles, emphasis, 'even', and scope
description: Emphasis and scope control that changes meaning dramatically in reading (も/でも/さえ/すら/まで/こそ etc.).

notes_grammar: In negative sentences, 'Nも〜ない' often means 'not even one'.

entries.meaning: even N; even a minimal example
entries.example_jp: 子どもでも分かります。

entries.meaning: even; if only; as long as
entries.example_jp: 水さえあれば生きられる。
entries.example_en: If only you have water, you can live.

entries.example_jp: 名前すら覚えていない。
entries.example_en: I don't even remember the name.
I was scolded to the point of crying.
Now is exactly the time to start.

entries.example_jp: 彼が来ないなんて信じられない。
entries.example_en: I can't believe he won't come.

entries.example_jp: そんなことなど気にしないで。
entries.example_en: Don't worry about things like that.

entries.example_jp: 英語だけでなく、日本語も勉強しています。
entries.example_en: I study not only English but also Japanese.

entries.example_jp: 年齢に限らず参加できます。
entries.example_en: You can participate regardless of age.

entries.meaning: only when; just on that occasion
entries.example_jp: 忙しい日に限って電話が来る。
entries.example_en: Calls come only on busy days.

entries.example_jp: 彼は日本語はもちろん、英語も話せる。
entries.example_en: He can speak English as well as Japanese, needless to say.

entries.example_jp: 文句ばかり言っている。
必要なのは才能ではなく努力こそが大事だ。
entries.example_en: What is necessary is not talent, but effort itself.

entries.meaning: never when it comes to; (someone) doesn't
entries.example_jp: 彼に限って嘘をつくことはない。
entries.example_en: He, of all people, would never lie.
